main event: An extremely bright meteorite-like object was observed flashing from the northern horizon and disappearing over Greensboro, North Carolina on June 14, 1963.
interesting points: The object was extremely bright, like a missile or aircraft running light, but believed to be at an extreme altitude of 80-100,000 feet.
The object had jerky, erratic movements and sudden lateral motions, unlike a typical meteorite or aircraft.
The object was visible for about 13 minutes before going over the horizon too quickly to continue observing.
At the time of the sighting, the ECHO satellite was heading northeast at an altitude of 44 degrees, which may have been a factor.
Other similar sightings of extremely bright, erratic objects were reported in the area around Greensboro during this time period.
sighted object: extremely bright, meteorite-like object with erratic movements
